title: The battery
description: 1800 – Alessandro Volta: discovers electrochemical series and invents the battery

title: Teleological evolution
description: 1802 - Jean-Baptiste Lamarck: teleological evolution

title: Atomic theory
description: 1805 – John Dalton: Atomic Theory in Chemistry

title: Ørsted's electromagnetism
description: 1820 – Hans Christian Ørsted discovers a deep relationship between electricity and magnetism (electromagnetism)

title: Property of semiconductors
description: 1821 – Thomas Johann Seebeck is the first to observe a property of semiconductors

title: Carnot cycle
description: 1824 – Carnot: described the Carnot cycle, the idealized heat engine

title: Ohm's law
description: 1827 – Georg Ohm: Ohm's law (Electricity)

title: Avogadros's law
description: 1827 – Amedeo Avogadro: Avogadro's law (Gas law)

title: Friedrich Wöhler
description: 1828 – Friedrich Wöhler synthesized urea, destroying vitalism

title: Electromagnetic induction
description: 1831 – Michael Faraday discovers electromagnetic induction

title: First enzyme
description: 1833 – Anselme Payen isolates first enzyme, diastase

title: Matthias Schleiden
description: 1838 – Matthias Schleiden: all plants are made of cells

title: Doppler effect
description: 1842 – Christian Doppler: Doppler effect

title: Law of Conservation of energy
description: 1843 – James Prescott Joule: Law of Conservation of energy (First law of thermodynamics)

title: Absolute zero
description: 1848 – Lord Kelvin: absolute zero

title: Rudolf Virchow
description: 1858 – Rudolf Virchow: cells can only arise from pre-existing cells

title: Theory of evolution
description: 1859 – Charles Darwin: Theory of evolution by natural selection

title: Maxwell's electromagnetism
description: 1864 – James Clerk Maxwell: Theory of electromagnetism

title: Mendel's laws of inheritance
description: 1865 – Gregor Mendel: Mendel's laws of inheritance, basis for genetics

title: Periodic table
description: 1869 – Dmitri Mendeleev: Periodic table

title: Thermionic emission
description: 1873 – Frederick Guthrie discovers thermionic emission.

title: Van der Waals
description: 1873 – Johannes Diderik van der Waals: was one of the first to postulate an intermolecular force

title: Photoconductivity
description: 1873 - Willoughby Smith discovers photoconductivity

title: Cathode rays
description: 1875 – William Crookes invented the Crookes tube and studied cathode rays

title: The phase rule
description: 1876 – Josiah Willard Gibbs founded chemical thermodynamics, the phase rule

title: Entropy
description: 1877 – Ludwig Boltzmann: Statistical definition of entropy

title: Liquid crystals
description: 1888 – Friedrich Reinitzer discovers liquid crystals.

title: Radioactivity
description: 1896 – Henri Becquerel discovers radioactivity

title: Greenhouse effect
description: 1896 - Svante Arrhenius derives the basic principles of the greenhouse effect.

title: Plum pudding model
description: 1898 – J.J. Thomson proposed the Plum pudding model of an atom
